justification: The Methods section states that “we exposed younger and older adults to a widely used task to measure prosociality (modified dictator game, Hutcherson et al., 2015).”
Under “Inhibitory control battery” the article notes that the battery “included a Go-Nogo… task… designed to assess (amongst other constructs) inhibition performance.”
The same battery description lists a “Stroop” task as one of “three inhibition tasks… to assess… inhibition performance.”
The inhibition battery also “included a … Stop Signal task,” which the authors used to compute a stop-signal reaction time as part of the composite inhibition score.
The EmpaToM is described as “a video-based social understanding task… designed to measure empathy… behavioural empathy was defined by mean valence ratings in emotional minus neutral trials.”
For the EmpaToM, “behavioural compassion was operationalized by mean compassion ratings across emotional and neutral trials.”
The same task assessed ToM: “behavioural ToM was analyzed by utilizing the accuracy in ToM-trials.”
To compute fluid abilities, the authors “assessed processing speed with the IDP, working memory with the DSb, visual attention with the TMT A, and complex attention with the TMT B.”
The article states that “SAW scores… were used for the average composite score of verbal capacities.”
